isis.stitle: TSI 05-12-11 - New Crankcase-to-Head Tube Assembly and Injection Control Pressure (ICP) Adapter/Plug Kit for Diagnostics

subjectgroup.subject: New Crankcase-to-Head Tube Assembly and Injection Control Pressure (ICP) Adapter/Plug Kit for Diagnostics

geninfo.para: Release new crankcase-to-head tube assembly, part number 1846758C91 (Figure 1) and new ICP Adapter/Plug kit, part number ZTSE4690 used for engine diagnosis.

geninfo.title: Crankcase-to-head tube assembly

figure.caption: Figure 1. Old and new crankcase-to-head tube and plug assemblies

geninfo.para: Original (short plug) crankcase-to-head tube assembly (Figure 1, Items 1 and 2) is no longer available for service. The new (check valve-in-plug type) crankcase-to-head tube assembly (Figure 1, Items 3 and 4) is a direct replacement for the old. The new crankcase-to-head tube assembly consists of a plug (with check valve), tube, and pre-installed D-rings.

figure.caption: Figure 2. New and old crankcase-to-head tube plug

calloutgroup.callout1: New (hex head) check valve-in-plug type crankcase-to-head tube plug
Old (square head) short crankcase-to-head tube plug

geninfo.para: Determine if the crankcase-to-head tube assembly is the old (square head socket) or the new (hex head socket) (Figure 2).
Depending upon build date, serial number, and any previous service, the engine may be configured as follows:

item.para: One short plug crankcase-to-head tube assembly in each cylinder head.
One short plug crankcase-to-head tube assembly in one cylinder head and one check valve-in-plug type crankcase-to-head tube assembly in the other cylinder head.
One check valve-in-plug type crankcase-to-head tube assembly in each cylinder head.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, it is recommended that the crankcase-to-head tube assembly be replaced each time it is removed. If you reuse the crankcase-to-head tube, you assume the risk for leakage. You must inspect each D-ring carefully for evidence of cutting, abrasion, or twisting. Never reuse a tube exhibiting any of these seal conditions.

geninfo.title: ICP adapter/plug kit

figure.caption: Figure 3. New ICP adapter/plug kit, ZTSE4690

calloutgroup.callout1: ICP leak test plug (solid hex head)

figure.caption: Figure 4. Old ICP adapter/plug kit, ZTSE 4668

calloutgroup.callout1: ICP leak test plug (solid hex head)

geninfo.para: If the new check-in-plug type crankcase-to-head tube assembly is in the engine, you will need to use the new ICP adapter/plug kit (Figure 3) to test the Injector Control Pressure system. However, if an old (short plug) crankcase-to-head tube assembly is in the engine, you will need to use the old ICP adapter/plug kit (Figure 4) to test the Injector Control Pressure system.

Never attempt to use an old adapter/plug kit for testing the new check-in-plug crankcase-to-head tube assembly, or a misdiagnosis will result. Conversely, never attempt to use the new adapter/plug kit for testing the old (short plug) crankcase-to-head tube assembly, or a misdiagnosis will result.

caution.para: To avoid the possibility of a misdiagnosis or damage to the engine, never use an old adapter/plug kit for testing the new check-in-plug crankcase-to-head tube assembly or a new adapter/plug kit for testing the old (short plug) crankcase-to-head tube assembly.

geninfo.title: T-handle removal tool
geninfo.para: Additionally, there is a tool used to remove the crankcase-to-head tube. If the crankcase-to-head tube proves difficult to remove, use the T-handle extractor (Figure 5).
If the crankcase-to-head tube assembly becomes separated, push the T-handle Removal Tool into the tube. Tighten the T-handle until a positive lock can be felt. Pull out tube and discard.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, it is recommended that the crankcase-to-head tube assembly be replaced each time it is removed. If you reuse the crankcase-to-head tube, you assume the risk for leakage. You must inspect each D-ring carefully for evidence of cutting, abrasion, or twisting. Never reuse a tube exhibiting any of these seal conditions.
